author: wsjcom
title: Friedman vs. Mundell on Monetary Reform
text:
Sean Rushton’s “Monetary Reform Would Rebalance Trade” (op-ed, March 29) could mislead some about the role played by the Bretton Woods conference, which was held before the close of World War II, not after World War II as suggested in his piece.
The U.S. dollar was backed by gold only for international purposes. It led to the preposterous dichotomy where U.S. citizens were forbidden to demand gold for their dollars, but foreigners could and did demand gold for theirs.
...
